item.title: 桥水联合首席投资官称目前持有美股是 "好事
item.description: 桥水联合投资公司（Bridgewater Associates）联席首席投资官卡伦-卡尼奥尔-坦布尔（Karen Karniol-Tambour）周二表示，持有美国股票是一件 "好事"，并称她预计当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将带来强劲的经济增长。【原文：Bridgewater Associates Co-Chief Investment Officer Karen Karniol-Tambour said on Tuesday U.S. stocks are a "good thing" to hold, adding she expects robust economic growth under President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 卡什卡利称美联储政策 "限制性适度
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他认为美国的货币政策目前 "限制性适度"，短期借贷成本继续拖累通胀和经济，但幅度不大。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank President Neel Kashkari said he feels U.S. monetary policy is currently "modestly restrictive," with short-term borrowing costs continuing to slow inflation and the economy, but not by a lot.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，美国银行第三季度贷款需求疲软
item.description: 美联储周二公布的一项调查显示，第三季度美国银行对一类关键的商业贷款需求疲软，而消费者信用卡和汽车贷款的需求状况也有所疲软。【原文：U.S. banks saw weaker demand for a key category of business loans during the third quarter, while the demand picture for consumer credit card and auto loans also softened, according to a Federal Reserve survey out on Tuesday that showed the Fed's pivot to lower interest rates has yet to improve credit demand.】

item.title: 美国银行首席执行官敦促特朗普政府解决美国预算问题
item.description: 美国银行首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）周二表示，他预计当选总统唐纳德-特朗普即将上任的政府将解决美国的预算问题。【原文：Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said on Tuesday he expected President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration to tackle the U.S. budget.】

item.title: 消息人士称，特朗普之子小唐将加入风险投资公司 1789 Capital
item.description: 据熟悉当选总统唐纳德-特朗普计划的三位消息人士透露，他的长子小唐纳德-特朗普将加入风险投资公司 1789 Capital，该公司专注于投资保守派公司。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump's eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., is joining venture capital firm 1789 Capital, which focuses on investing in conservative companies, according to three sources familiar with his plans.】

item.title: BBVA 的萨瓦德尔竞购陷入对竞争和墨西哥的担忧之中
item.description: 随着西班牙监管机构对 BBVA 的收购进行深入审查，BBVA 对萨瓦德尔的长期追逐变得更加漫长，在唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国大选后，萨瓦德尔的价值进一步下跌，这加剧了人们对其墨西哥业务的担忧。【原文：BBVA's long pursuit of Sabadell is becoming even longer, with Spanish regulators launching an in-depth review of its bid, which fell further in value after Donald Trump's U.S. election victory fuelled concerns over its Mexican business.】

item.title: 沙特 NEOM 长期首席执行官离职，沙特缩减大型项目规模
item.description: 沙特王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）发起的价值 5000 亿美元的沙特开发项目 NEOM 的长期首席执行官纳德米-纳斯尔（Nadhmi al-Nasr）已离职，NEOM 周二表示，但未说明原因。【原文：Nadhmi al-Nasr, the long-time chief executive of the $500 billion Saudi development project NEOM launched by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, has departed, NEOM said on Tuesday without giving a reason.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空客即将与 Spirit Aero 就融资和付款条件达成协议
item.description: 一位熟知内情的人士透露，空中客车公司准备最早于本周三与陷入困境的航空航天供应商 Spirit Aerosystems 公司就新的融资和修订付款条件达成协议。【原文：Airbus is poised to finalise an agreement as early as Wednesday with struggling aerospace supplier Spirit Aerosystems on fresh funding and revised payment terms, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美国起诉阻止 UnitedHealth 以 33 亿美元收购 Amedisys
item.description: 美国司法部和美国三个州周二提起诉讼，要求阻止联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）斥资 33 亿美元收购 Amedisys 公司（Amedisys Inc），原因是担心该交易会损害家庭医疗服务市场的竞争。【原文：The Justice Department and three U.S. states filed a lawsuit on Tuesday to block UnitedHealth Group's $3.3 billion purchase of Amedisys Inc over concern the deal would harm competition in the market for home health services, the department said.】

item.title: 瑞士电信提出新方案以赢得意大利对沃达丰交易的批准
item.description: 路透社看到的一封信显示，瑞士电信在 10 月底向意大利反垄断机构提出了第二套补救措施，以争取意大利反垄断机构批准瑞士电信将其意大利子公司 Fastweb 与沃达丰在该国的资产合并的计划。【原文：Swisscom offered a second set of remedies to Italy's antitrust authority at the end of October to win approval for a planned deal to combine its Italian arm Fastweb with Vodafone assets in the country, a letter seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 高管称，特朗普政府可能会刺激大型银行交易
item.description: 金融高管和分析师周二表示，随着美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，政府任命的监管机构对批准大型交易持更加开放的态度，这可能会迎来银行并购浪潮。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump's return to the White House could usher in a wave of bank mergers and acquisitions as the administration appoints regulators who are more open to approving larger deals, financial executives and analysts said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）报告称，"银行存款不足 "的家庭更有可能拥有加密货币
item.description: 根据周二发布的一份政府报告，被认为是 "银行不足 "的美国家庭--或者依赖支票兑现和发薪日贷款等服务来满足其金融需求的家庭--比那些更容易接触到传统银行系统的家庭更有可能持有加密货币。【原文：American households considered "underbanked" -- or who rely on services like check cashing and payday loans to meet their financial needs -- are more likely to hold cryptocurrencies than households with better access to the traditional banking system, according to a government report released Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，ValueAct 公司以 10 亿美元入股 Meta 公司
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周二透露，对冲基金 ValueAct Capital 已入股 Facebook 和 Instagram 母公司 Meta Platforms，金额达 10 亿美元。【原文：Hedge fund ValueAct Capital has taken a $1 billion stake in Facebook and Instagram-parent Meta Platforms , a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音罢工导致 10 月交付的喷气式飞机降至 14 架
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，在长达数周的罢工导致其大部分飞机生产停止后，该公司在 10 月份交付了 14 架商用喷气式飞机，不到 2023 年同期交付给客户的 34 架喷气式飞机的一半。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday it delivered 14 commercial jets in October, less than half of the 34 jets it handed over to customers during the same month in 2023, after a weeks-long strike halted most of its aircraft production.】

item.title: 纽约联储调查显示，美国消费者认为通胀和债务拖欠风险较低
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周二进行的一项调查显示，10月份美国消费者对通胀继续缓解和就业市场健康状况的信心有所增强，他们认为债务违约的风险降低，这是五个月来的第一次。【原文：U.S. consumers in October grew more confident about inflation continuing to ease and in the health of the job market, and for the first time in five months they saw a lower risk of defaulting on their debt, a survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 在洛杉矶向所有人开放自动驾驶打车服务
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的 Waymo 公司周二表示，其自动驾驶打车服务 Waymo One 现已在洛杉矶向所有人开放，这标志着该技术的快速发展和采用。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo said on Tuesday its autonomous ride-hailing service, Waymo One, is now available to everyone in Los Angeles, a sign of rapid growth and adoption of the technology.】

item.title: 美联储的沃勒稳定币可为金融体系带来好处
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周二表示，稳定币实际上是 "合成 "美元，可以为金融系统带来好处。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said Tuesday stablecoins are effectively “synthetic” dollars that can bring benefits to the financial system.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息称德国商业银行考虑在联合信贷银行防御计划中收购国内竞争对手
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社，德国商业银行正在权衡收购一家德国中型银行，作为其抵御意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）可能收购的战略的一部分。【原文：Commerzbank is weighing the acquisition of a mid-sized German bank as part of its strategy to fend off a possible takeover by Italy's UniCredit , three people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 加拿大以经济损失为由采取行动结束港口劳资纠纷
item.description: 加拿大周二以经济损失和可能赶走贸易伙伴为由，采取行动结束了温哥华和蒙特利尔两大港口的劳资纠纷。【原文：Canada on Tuesday moved to end labor disputes at the country's two biggest ports, Vancouver and Montreal, citing economic damage and the potential for driving away trading partners.】

item.title: 美联储的沃勒私营部门应引领支付系统创新
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周二表示，他认为私营部门应在支付领域的创新方面发挥主导作用。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Tuesday that he believes the private sector should lead when it comes to payment sector innovations.】

item.title: 巴金表示，美联储 "有能力 "在必要时应对风险
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周二表示，随着通胀率接近美联储2%的目标，劳动力市场富有弹性，美国央行正在降低借贷成本，如果通胀压力上升或就业市场疲软，决策者已做好应对准备。【原文：With inflation close to the Federal Reserve's 2% target, the labor market resilient, and the U.S. central bank in the process of lowering borrowing costs, policymakers are ready to respond if inflation pressures rise or the job market weakens, Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷通胀率有所下降，但消费者仍感觉受到挤压
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）大刀阔斧的紧缩政策帮助降低了通货膨胀，但经济增长放缓是以消费为代价的。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei's dramatic austerity agenda has helped lower inflation, but the slowdown has come at the cost of consumption in a battered economy where more than half of the country has fallen into poverty.】

item.title: 卡夫-海因茨从美国免费和低价学校午餐计划中撤下主要的 Lunchables 餐点
item.description: 卡夫亨氏公司在一份声明中称，该公司将不再为接受联邦计划提供的免费或减价膳食的低收入学生生产其包装午餐品牌 Lunchables，这是对该公司最具标志性产品之一的最新打击。【原文：Kraft Heinz is no longer making its packaged lunch brand Lunchables for low-income students receiving free and reduced-priced meals from a federal program, according to a company statement, the latest blow to one of the company's most iconic products.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称辉瑞正在探索出售医院用药部门
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的人士透露，辉瑞公司正在探索出售其医院用药部门，因为这家制药商一直受到激进投资者 Starboard Value 的压力，希望剥离非核心资产。【原文：Pfizer is exploring the sale of its hospital drugs unit, as the drugmaker, which has been under pressure from activist investor Starboard Value, looks to divest non-core assets, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国最高法院不会审理纽约租金稳定法冲突案
item.description: 美国最高法院周二拒绝审理业主团体挑战纽约市租金稳定法的诉讼，该法规定了租金上涨的上限，并增加了驱逐租户的难度。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Tuesday to hear a bid by landlord groups to challenge rent stabilization laws in New York City that cap rent hikes and make it harder to evict tenants.】

item.title: 精神公司将从波音公司获得高达 3.5 亿美元的预付款
item.description: 精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）周二表示，波音公司将向该公司支付总额高达 3.5 亿美元的预付款，这为这家陷入困境的供应商提供了一条救命稻草，因为该公司在连续四年亏损后仍在继续烧钱。【原文：Spirit AeroSystems said on Tuesday that Boeing will pay a total of up to $350 million in advance payments to the firm, providing the struggling supplier a lifeline as it continues to burn cash after four consecutive years of losses.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国司法部准备就 UnitedHealth-Amedisys 交易提起诉讼
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国司法部正着手阻止联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）斥资 33 亿美元收购 Amedisys 公司（Amedisys Inc.【原文：The U.S. Justice Department is moving to block UnitedHealth Group's $3.3 billion purchase of Amedisys Inc. over concerns the deal would harm competition in the market for home health services, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亚马逊为人工智能研究人员提供免费计算能力，旨在挑战英伟达
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）云计算部门周二表示，将向希望使用其定制人工智能芯片的研究人员提供免费计算能力，旨在挑战英伟达（Nvidia）在这些研究人员中的受欢迎程度。【原文：Amazon.com's cloud computing unit on Tuesday said it will offer free computing power to researchers who want to use its custom artificial intelligence chips, aiming to challenge Nvidia's popularity among those researchers.】

item.title: Netflix 的广告支持层用户达到 7000 万
item.description: Netflix 周二表示，其广告支持层目前在全球拥有 7000 万月活跃用户，比今年早些时候报告的数字几乎翻了一番。【原文：Netflix said on Tuesday that its ad-supported tier now has 70 million monthly active users globally, nearly doubling the number reported earlier this year.】

item.title: Meta 将在欧洲提供个性化程度更低的广告，以安抚监管机构
item.description: 科技巨头 Meta Platforms 周二宣布，计划为欧洲的 Instagram 和 Facebook 用户提供接收 "个性化程度较低的广告 "的选择，以消除监管机构日益增长的担忧。【原文：Meta Platforms plans to offer Instagram and Facebook users in Europe the option to receive "less personalized ads," the tech giant announced on Tuesday, in an effort to allay regulators' mounting concerns.】
